title: Getting started with xkcd
code: df <- gapminder::gapminder |>   filter(country %in% c("United States", "United Kingdom", "Canada", "Australia"))  df |>   x_chart(title = "my xkcd line graph") |>   x_line(x = "year", y = "lifeExp", color = "country")

title: Getting started with xkcd
text: line parameter x_point controls wheather points connected, can used like geom_point + geom_line ggplot2.
code: iris |>   x_chart() |>   x_point(x = "Sepal.Width", y = "Sepal.Length", fill = "Species", size = 1.5) |>   x_options(title = "scatterplot", palette = c("#f7feae", "#46aea0", "#045275")) data.frame(x = 1:10, y = rnorm(10)) |>   x_chart() |>   x_point(x = "x", y = "y", line = TRUE) |>   x_options(ylabel = "")

title: Getting started with xkcd
text: Stacked bar chart pie chart (support grouping)
code: data.frame(   character = c("Ross", "Rachel", "Joey", "Phoebe", "Monica", "Chandler"),   relationships = c(16, 14, 17, 16, 13, 9) ) |>   x_chart(title = "# of relationships in Friends") |>   x_bar(x = "character", y = "relationships") |>   x_options(legend = FALSE) t <- as.data.frame(Titanic) t <- t[rep(1:nrow(t), t$Freq), c("Class", "Survived")]  t |>   count(Class, Survived) |>   x_chart(title = "Titanic survivors by class and age") |>   x_bar(x = "Class", y = "n", fill = "Survived") |>   x_options(ylabel = "") data.frame(   x = 1:6,   y = 1:6 ) |>   x_chart(title = "What I am made of") |>   x_pie(x = "x", y = "y", radius = 0) |>   x_options(legend_position = 2)

title: Getting started with xkcd
code: data.frame(   x = rep(c("strength", "patience", "skillfulness", "resilience", "flexibility"), 2),   y = abs(rnorm(10)),   g = rep(c("tiger", "lion"), each = 5) ) |>   x_chart(title = "Tiger and lion: a random comparison") |>   x_radar(x = "x", y = "y", color = "g")

title: Getting started with xkcd
text: Common options apply types plots (set via x_options): title: plot title xlabel: x-axis title, default x variable ylabel: y-axis title, default x variable palette: color palette grouping variables, number colors equal number groups font_family: fonts use, default “xkcd” legend: whether show legend legend_position: legend position, 1 (top-right), 2 (top-left), 3 (bottom-left), 4 (bottom-right) time_format: time format use x values time, chart.xkcd use  format time, find available formats https://github.com/iamkun/dayjs/blob/dev/docs/en/API-reference.md#list---available-formats x_breaks: number breaks x axis, default 3 y_breaks: number breaks y axis, default 3 specific options plot type: size: dot size, default 1 line: dots connected, default FALSE radius: arc radius, default 0.5, traditional pie chart set 0 size: dot size, default 1 label: whether show labels dimension, default TRUE ticks number ticks dimension

title: Common configuration options — xkcd-option
code: x_options(   w,   title = NULL,   xlabel = NULL,   ylabel = NULL,   palette = NULL,   font_family = "xkcd",   stroke = "black",   background = "white",   legend = TRUE,   legend_position = 1,   time_format = NULL,   x_breaks = 3,   y_breaks = 3,   ... )  x_label(w, title = NULL, xlabel = NULL, ylabel = NULL)  x_title(w, title = NULL)  x_legend(w, legend = TRUE, legend_position = 1)

title: Common configuration options — xkcd-option
text: x_breaks number breaks x axis y_breaks number breaks y axis w: xkcd widget object title: title xlabel: title x axis ylabel: title y axis palette: color palette different groups font_family: font family stroke: color axis, title legend box background: background color legend: legend shown legend_position: integer controlling legend position, 1 (left), 2 (right), 3 (left), 4 (right) time_format: time format use x values time, chart.xkcd use dayjs format time,  find available formats https://github.com/iamkun/dayjs/blob/dev/docs/en/API-reference.md#list---available-formats
